Example:

<attachedVMList>
  <attachedVM>
    <objectId>vm-17</objectId>
    <objectTypeName>VirtualMachine</objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid>564D5E43-1A21-9061-CE62-16E4E64FBC52</vsmUuid>
    <revision>1</revision>
    <type>
      <typeName>VirtualMachine</typeName>
    </type>
    <name>Ubuntu2</name>
    <scope>
      <id>domain-c7</id>
      <objectTypeName>ClusterComputeResource</objectTypeName>
      <name>sp cluster</name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle />
    <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
    <instanceUUID>520932b3-b531-7b4a-d3fe-76f0fdd82736</instanceUUID>
    <biosUUID>423f7c14-6463-8ebc-d06d-2a284b24cabb</biosUUID>
  </attachedVM>
  <attachedVM>
    <objectId>vm-59</objectId>
    <objectTypeName>VirtualMachine</objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid>564D5E43-1A21-9061-CE62-16E4E64FBC52</vsmUuid>
    <revision>1</revision>
    <type>
      <typeName>VirtualMachine</typeName>
    </type>
    <name>vShield-FW (1)</name>
    <scope>
      <id>domain-c7</id>
      <objectTypeName>ClusterComputeResource</objectTypeName>
      <name>sp cluster</name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle />
    <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
    <instanceUUID>502777a8-a4b0-6b1e-1af1-6ab43f3417a0</instanceUUID>
    <biosUUID>42278ffc-021c-cd1f-1413-978f34079593</biosUUID>
  </attachedVM>
</attachedVMList>

Secured by basic

securitytagVmId /vm/{vmId} get post

get

post

Update security tags associated with the specified virtual machine.

You can assign multiple tags at a time to the specified VM, or clear all assigned tags from the specified VM.

Method history:

    Specify VM using VM managed object ID or VM instance UUID.

post securitytagVmId /2.0/services/securitytags/vm/{vmId}

Update security tags associated with the specified virtual machine.

You can assign multiple tags at a time to the specified VM, or clear all assigned tags from the specified VM.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • vmId: required (string)

    Specify VM using VM managed object ID or VM instance UUID.

Query Parameters

  • action: required (string)

    Action to perform. ASSIGN_TAGS or CLEAR_ALL_TAGS.

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<securityTags>
  <securityTag>
    <objectId>securitytag-12</objectId>
  </securityTag>
  <securityTag>
    <objectId>securitytag-13</objectId>
  </securityTag>
  <securityTag>
    <objectId>securitytag-14</objectId>
  </securityTag>
</securityTags>

Secured by basic

securitytagsCriteria /selection-criteria get put

Working With Security Tags Unique ID Selection Criteria

In NSX versions before 6.3.0, security tags are local to a NSX Manager, and are mapped to VMs using the VM's managed object ID.

In NSX 6.3.0 and later, you can create universal security tags to use in all NSX Managers in a cross-vCenter NSX environment.

In an active standby environment, the managed object ID for a given VM might not be the same in the active and standby datacenters. NSX 6.3.x introduces a Unique ID Selection Criteria on the primary NSX Manager to use to identify VMs when attaching them to universal security tags only. You can use them singly or in combination. The VM instance UUID is the recommended selection criteria. See the descriptions for more information.

The default value for the selection criteria is null and must be set before assigning a universal security tag to a VM. The selection criteria can be set only on the primary NSX manager and is read-only on secondary NSX Managers.

Security Tag Assignment
Metadata Parameter		Description
instance_uuidThe VM instance UUID is generally unique within a vCenter domain, however there are exceptions such as when deployments are made through snapshots. If the VM instance UUID is not unique, you can use the VM BIOS UUID in combination with the VM name.
bios_uuidThe BIOS UUID is not guaranteed to be unique within a vCenter domain, but it is always preserved in case of disaster. Use BIOS UUID in combination with VM name to reduce the chance of a duplicate ID.
vmnameIf all of the VM names in an environment are unique, then VM name can be used to identify a VM across vCenters. Use VM name in combination with VM BIOS UUID to reduce the chance of a duplicate ID.
get

Retrieve unique ID section criteria configuration.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Method introduced.
put

Configure the unique ID section criteria configuration.

If you set the selection criteria and assign security tags to VMs, you must remove all security tags from VMs before you can change the selection criteria.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Method introduced.

get securitytagsCriteria /2.0/services/securitytags/selection-criteria

Retrieve unique ID section criteria configuration.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Security

Secured by basic

put securitytagsCriteria /2.0/services/securitytags/selection-criteria

Configure the unique ID section criteria configuration.

If you set the selection criteria and assign security tags to VMs, you must remove all security tags from VMs before you can change the selection criteria.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<securityTagAssignmentMetadata>
  <metadata>instance_uuid</metadata>
</securityTagAssignmentMetadata>

Secured by basic

ssoConfig

Working With NSX Manager SSO Registration

ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig get post delete

get

Retrieve SSO Configuration.

post

Register NSX Manager to SSO Services.

delete

Deletes the NSX Manager SSO Configuration.

get ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig

Retrieve SSO Configuration.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<ssoConfig>
  <ssoLookupServiceUrl>https://vc-l-01a.corp.local:443/lookservice/sdk</ssoLookupServiceUrl>
  <ssoAdminUsername>administrator@vsphere.local</ssoAdminUsername>
</ssoConfig>

Secured by basic

post ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig

Register NSX Manager to SSO Services.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ssoConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoLookupServiceUrl"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoAdminUsername"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoAdminUserpassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ssoConfig>
  <ssoLookupServiceUrl></ssoLookupServiceUrl>
  <ssoAdminUsername></ssoAdminUsername>
  <ssoAdminUserpassword></ssoAdminUserpassword>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
</ssoConfig>

Secured by basic

delete ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig

Deletes the NSX Manager SSO Configuration.

Secured by basic
  • Security

Secured by basic

userMgmtState /enablestate/{value} put

Working With User Account State

put

You can disable or enable a user account, either local user or vCenter user. When a user account is created, the account is enabled by default.

put userMgmtState /2.0/services/usermgmt/user/{userId}/enablestate/{value}

You can disable or enable a user account, either local user or vCenter user. When a user account is created, the account is enabled by default.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    User ID. To specify a domain user, use user@domain not domain\user.

  • value: required (integer)

    value can be 0 to disable, or 1 to enable.

Secured by basic

userRoleMgmt /role/{userId} get post put delete

Manage NSX Roles for Users

Possible roles are:

  • super_user - built-in admin user
  • vshield_admin - NSX Administrator
  • enterprise_admin - Enterprise Administrator
  • security_admin - Security Administrator
  • auditor - Auditor
  • security_engineer - Security Engineer (introduced in NSX 6.4.2)
  • network_engineer - Network Engineer (introduced in NSX 6.4.2)
  • security_role_admin - Security & Role Administrator (introduced in NSX 6.4.5)
get

Retrieve a user's role.

post

Add role and resources for a user.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method updated. Added security_engineer and network_engineer roles.
6.4.5Method updated. Added security_role_admin role.
put

Change a user's role.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method updated. Added security_engineer and network_engineer roles.
6.4.5Method updated. Added security_role_admin role.
delete

Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

get userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Retrieve a user's role.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    User ID. To specify a domain user, use user@domain not domain\user.

Secured by basic

post userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Add role and resources for a user.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method updated. Added security_engineer and network_engineer roles.
6.4.5Method updated. Added security_role_admin role.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    User ID. To specify a domain user, use user@domain not domain\user.

Query Parameters

  • isGroup: required (boolean)

    Set to true to apply to a group; set to false to apply to an individual user.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<accessControlEntry>
  <role></role>
  <resource>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

Secured by basic

          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>

servicesAuth

Working with API Authentication

authBasic /basic put get

Working with Basic Authentication

put

Update whether basic authentication is enabled.

Authentication headers are ignored, and the credentials used in the request body are used instead. This request works whether or not basic authenication is enabled.

All NSX Manager systems in a cross-vCenter NSX environment must have the same enabled/disabled status for basic authentication. If you disable basic authentication on one NSX Manager in a cross-vCenter NSX environment, you must disable it on all NSX Manager systems in the environment.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method introduced.
get

Retrieve basic authentication configuration.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method introduced.

put authBasic /2.0/services/auth/basic

Update whether basic authentication is enabled.

Authentication headers are ignored, and the credentials used in the request body are used instead. This request works whether or not basic authenication is enabled.

All NSX Manager systems in a cross-vCenter NSX environment must have the same enabled/disabled status for basic authentication. If you disable basic authentication on one NSX Manager in a cross-vCenter NSX environment, you must disable it on all NSX Manager systems in the environment.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<auth>
  <username>username</username>
  <password>password</password>
  <disableBasicAuth>false</disableBasicAuth>
</auth>

Secured by basic

get authBasic /2.0/services/auth/basic

Retrieve basic authentication configuration.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<basicAuthStatus>
  <disableBasicAuth>false</disableBasicAuth>
</basicAuthStatus>

Secured by basic

authToken /token post

Working with API Tokens

You can create a JSON Web Token and use it to authenticate with the NSX Manager appliance in subsequent API requests.

post

Create a new authentication token.

You can use this token in your REST client to access the API. Send the token in the Authorization header with the AUTHTOKEN keyword. See the documentation for your REST client for more information.

Example Authorization header:

Authorization: AUTHTOKEN eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJhZG1pbiIsImV4cCI6MTUyMDU1NTU0NH0.bXPVyHp6uR4HmCmyIMcgJQIS-E1xeb6MLz_3BDk7Lzw

By default, this token is created with the default expiry value. You can also set a custom expiration using the expiresInMinutes query parameter.

If a user authenticates with a token, and the user is deleted or their NSX access is disabled, their token will remain valid until the token expires.

To create a token when basic authentication is disabled, see POST /api/3.0/services/auth/token.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.

post authToken /2.0/services/auth/token

Create a new authentication token.

You can use this token in your REST client to access the API. Send the token in the Authorization header with the AUTHTOKEN keyword. See the documentation for your REST client for more information.

Example Authorization header:

Authorization: AUTHTOKEN eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJhZG1pbiIsImV4cCI6MTUyMDU1NTU0NH0.bXPVyHp6uR4HmCmyIMcgJQIS-E1xeb6MLz_3BDk7Lzw

By default, this token is created with the default expiry value. You can also set a custom expiration using the expiresInMinutes query parameter.

If a user authenticates with a token, and the user is deleted or their NSX access is disabled, their token will remain valid until the token expires.

To create a token when basic authentication is disabled, see POST /api/3.0/services/auth/token.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • expiresInMinutes: (string)

    Specify number of minutes for the token expiration. Valid values are 1-1440.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<authToken>
  <value>eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJhZG1pbiIsImV4cCI6MTUyMDU1NTU0NH0
         .bXPVyHp6uR4HmCmyIMcgJQIS-E1xeb6MLz_3BDk7Lzw</value>
</authToken>

Secured by basic

tokenExpire /tokenexpiration put get

Working With API Token Expiration

You can configure the default expiry time of API tokens. New tokens are created with this expiry time.

put

Update the default token expiry time.

The default expiry time is 90 minutes. The maximum expiry time is 24 hours.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.
get

Retrieve the default token expiry time.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.

put tokenExpire /2.0/services/auth/tokenexpiration

Update the default token expiry time.

The default expiry time is 90 minutes. The maximum expiry time is 24 hours.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<authTokenExpiry>
  <defaultExpiryInMinutes>90</defaultExpiryInMinutes>  
</authTokenExpiry>

Secured by basic

get tokenExpire /2.0/services/auth/tokenexpiration

Retrieve the default token expiry time.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<authTokenExpiry>
  <defaultExpiryInMinutes>180</defaultExpiryInMinutes>  
</authTokenExpiry>

Secured by basic

Invalidate tokens created by the specified user.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • userId: (string)

    Specify which user the token was created by. Specify username (e.g. admin). Domain users can be specified as either user@domain or domain\user.

Secured by basic

3AuthToken

Working with API Authentication

3AuthToken /3.0/services/auth/token post

post

Create a new authentication token.

Authentication headers are ignored, and the credentials used in the request body are used instead. This request works whether or not Basic Authenication is enabled.

You can use this token in your REST client to access the API. Send the token in the Authorization header with the AUTHTOKEN keyword. See the documentation for your REST client for more information.

Example Authorization header:

Authorization: AUTHTOKEN eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJhZG1pbiIsImV4cCI6MTUyMDU1NTU0NH0.bXPVyHp6uR4HmCmyIMcgJQIS-E1xeb6MLz_3BDk7Lzw

By default, this token is created with the default expiry value (see GET/PUT /api/2.0/services/auth/tokenexpiration). You can also set a custom expiration using the expiresInMinutes query parameter.

If a user authenticates with a token, and the user is deleted or their NSX access is disabled, their token will remain valid until the token expires.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method introduced.

post 3AuthToken /3.0/services/auth/token

Create a new authentication token.

Authentication headers are ignored, and the credentials used in the request body are used instead. This request works whether or not Basic Authenication is enabled.

You can use this token in your REST client to access the API. Send the token in the Authorization header with the AUTHTOKEN keyword. See the documentation for your REST client for more information.

Example Authorization header:

Authorization: AUTHTOKEN eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJhZG1pbiIsImV4cCI6MTUyMDU1NTU0NH0.bXPVyHp6uR4HmCmyIMcgJQIS-E1xeb6MLz_3BDk7Lzw

By default, this token is created with the default expiry value (see GET/PUT /api/2.0/services/auth/tokenexpiration). You can also set a custom expiration using the expiresInMinutes query parameter.

If a user authenticates with a token, and the user is deleted or their NSX access is disabled, their token will remain valid until the token expires.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.2Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • expiresInMinutes: (string)

    Specify number of minutes for the token expiration. Valid values are 1-1440.

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<credentials>
  <username>test</username>
  <password>testing123!</password>
</credentials>

Secured by basic

secGroup

Working With Security Group Grouping Objects

A security group is a collection of assets or grouping objects from your vSphere inventory.

secGroupBulk /bulk/{scopeId} post

Creating New Security Groups With Members

post

Create a new security group on a global scope or universal scope with membership information.

Universal security groups are read-only when querying a secondary NSX manager.

When you create a universal security group (on scope universalroot-0) by default localMembersOnly is set to false which indicates that the universal security group will contain members across the cross-vCenter NSX environment. This is the case in an active active environment. You can add the following objects to a universal security group with localMembersOnly=false (active active):

  • IP Address Set
  • MAC Address Set
  • Universal Security Groups with localMembersOnly=false

When you create a universal security group (on scope universalroot-0) you can set the extendedAttribute localMembersOnly to true to indicate that the universal security group will contain members local to that NSX Manager only. This is the case in an active standby environment, because only one NSX environment is active at a time, and the same VMs are present in each NSX environment. You can add the following objects to a universal security group with localMembersOnly=true (active standby):

  • Universal Security Tag
  • IP Address Set
  • MAC Address Set
  • Universal Security Groups with localMembersOnly=true
  • Dynamic criteria using VM name

You can set the localMembersOnly attribute only when the universal security group is created, it cannot be modified afterwards.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Extended attribute localMembersOnly introduced.

post secGroupBulk /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId}

Create a new security group on a global scope or universal scope with membership information.

Universal security groups are read-only when querying a secondary NSX manager.

When you create a universal security group (on scope universalroot-0) by default localMembersOnly is set to false which indicates that the universal security group will contain members across the cross-vCenter NSX environment. This is the case in an active active environment. You can add the following objects to a universal security group with localMembersOnly=false (active active):

  • IP Address Set
  • MAC Address Set
  • Universal Security Groups with localMembersOnly=false

When you create a universal security group (on scope universalroot-0) you can set the extendedAttribute localMembersOnly to true to indicate that the universal security group will contain members local to that NSX Manager only. This is the case in an active standby environment, because only one NSX environment is active at a time, and the same VMs are present in each NSX environment. You can add the following objects to a universal security group with localMembersOnly=true (active standby):

  • Universal Security Tag
  • IP Address Set
  • MAC Address Set
  • Universal Security Groups with localMembersOnly=true
  • Dynamic criteria using VM name

You can set the localMembersOnly attribute only when the universal security group is created, it cannot be modified afterwards.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Extended attribute localMembersOnly introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    For the scopeId use globalroot-0 for non-universal security groups and universalroot-0 for universal security groups.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeMember">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="dynamicMemberDefinition">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="dynamicSet">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                    <xs:element name="dynamicCriteria">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="criteria"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes>
    <extendedAttribute>
      <name>localMembersOnly</name>
      <value>true</value>
    </extendedAttribute>
  </extendedAttributes>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </member>
  <excludeMember>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </excludeMember>
  <dynamicMemberDefinition>
    <dynamicSet>
      <operator></operator>
      <dynamicCriteria>
        <operator></operator>
        <key></key>
        <criteria></criteria>
        <value></value>
      </dynamicCriteria>
    </dynamicSet>
  </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>

Secured by basic

secGroupScopeId /{scopeId} post

Creating New Security Groups Without Members

post

Create a new security group, with no membership information specified. You can add members later with PUT /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{objectId}

When you create a universal security group (on scope universalroot-0) by default localMembersOnly is set to false which indicates that the universal security group will contain members across the cross-vCenter NSX environment. This is the case in an active active environment. You can add the following objects to a universal security group with localMembersOnly=false (active active):

  • IP Address Set
  • MAC Address Set
  • Universal Security Groups with localMembersOnly=false

When you create a universal security group (on scope universalroot-0) you can set the extendedAttribute localMembersOnly to true to indicate that the universal security group will contain members local to that NSX Manager only. This is the case in an active standby environment, because only one NSX environment is active at a time, and the same VMs are present in each NSX environment. You can add the following objects to a universal security group with localMembersOnly=true (active standby):

  • Universal Security Tag
  • IP Address Set
  • MAC Address Set
  • Universal Security Groups with localMembersOnly=true
  • Dynamic criteria using VM name

You can set the localMembersOnly attribute only when the universal security group is created, it cannot be modified afterwards.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Extended attribute localMembersOnly introduced.

post secGroupScopeId /2.0/services/securitygroup/{scopeId}

Create a new security group, with no membership information specified. You can add members later with PUT /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{objectId}

When you create a universal security group (on scope universalroot-0) by default localMembersOnly is set to false which indicates that the universal security group will contain members across the cross-vCenter NSX environment. This is the case in an active active environment. You can add the following objects to a universal security group with localMembersOnly=false (active active):

  • IP Address Set
  • MAC Address Set
  • Universal Security Groups with localMembersOnly=false

When you create a universal security group (on scope universalroot-0) you can set the extendedAttribute localMembersOnly to true to indicate that the universal security group will contain members local to that NSX Manager only. This is the case in an active standby environment, because only one NSX environment is active at a time, and the same VMs are present in each NSX environment. You can add the following objects to a universal security group with localMembersOnly=true (active standby):

  • Universal Security Tag
  • IP Address Set
  • MAC Address Set
  • Universal Security Groups with localMembersOnly=true
  • Dynamic criteria using VM name

You can set the localMembersOnly attribute only when the universal security group is created, it cannot be modified afterwards.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.0Extended attribute localMembersOnly introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeId: required (string)

    For the scopeId use globalroot-0 for non-universal security groups and universalroot-0 for universal security groups.

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<securitygroup>
  <name></name>
  <extendedAttributes>
    <extendedAttribute>
      <name>localMembersOnly</name>
      <value>true</value>
    </extendedAttribute>
  </extendedAttributes>
</securitygroup>

    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>

        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>

          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>

        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>

          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>

                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>

                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeMember">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>

              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>

                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>

                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>

              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>

        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

      <name></name>

    <extendedAttributes/>
  </member>

      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>

    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </excludeMember>
  <dynamicMemberDefinition>
    <dynamicSet>
      <operator></operator>
      <dynamicCriteria>
        <operator></operator>
        <key></key>
        <criteria></criteria>
        <value></value>
      </dynamicCriteria>
    </dynamicSet>
  </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>

Secured by basic

secGroupObject /{objectId} get put delete

Working With a Specific Security Group

get

Retrieve all members of the specified security group.

put

Update configuration for the specified security group. Members are not updated. You must use PUT /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{objectId} to update a security group membership.

delete

Delete an existing security group.

If force=true is specified, the object is deleted even if used in other configurations, such as firewall rules. If force=true is not specified, the object is deleted only if it is not used by other configuration; otherwise the delete fails.

get secGroupObject /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}

Retrieve all members of the specified security group.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Security group ID.

Secured by basic

put secGroupObject /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}

Update configuration for the specified security group. Members are not updated. You must use PUT /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{objectId} to update a security group membership.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Security group ID.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isUniversal"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <name></name>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <isUniversal></isUniversal>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</securitygroup>

Secured by basic

delete secGroupObject /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}

Delete an existing security group.

If force=true is specified, the object is deleted even if used in other configurations, such as firewall rules. If force=true is not specified, the object is deleted only if it is not used by other configuration; otherwise the delete fails.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Security group ID.

Query Parameters

  • force: (boolean)

    Use force=true to force removal of security group that is in use in other configurations.

Secured by basic

secGroupMember /members/{memberId} put delete

Working With Members of a Specific Security Group

put

Add a new member to the specified security group.

delete

Delete member from the specified security group.

put secGroupMember /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}/members/{memberId}

Add a new member to the specified security group.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Security group ID.

  • memberId: required (string)

    Security group member, can be a vSphere managed object ID or NSX object ID.

Query Parameters

  • failIfExists: (boolean - default: true)

    Default is true.

    If failIfExists=false:

    • If the member is not already present in the SecurityGroup, the API adds the member to the SecurityGroup.
    • If the member is already present in the SecurityGroup, the API will be a no-op and will return silently.

    If failIfExists=true:

    • If the member is not already present in the SecurityGroup, the API adds the member to the SecurityGroup.
    • If the member is already present in the SecurityGroup, the API call fails.

Secured by basic

delete secGroupMember /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}/members/{memberId}

Delete member from the specified security group.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Security group ID.

  • memberId: required (string)

    Security group member, can be a vSphere managed object ID or NSX object ID.

Query Parameters

  • failIfAbsent: (boolean - default: true)

    Default is true.

    If failIfAbsent=false:

    • If the member is present in the SecurityGroup, the API removes the member from the SecurityGroup.
    • If the member is not present in the SecurityGroup, the API call will be a no-op and will return silently.

    If failIfExists=true:

    • If the member is present in the SecurityGroup, the API removes the member from the SecurityGroup.
    • If the member is not present in the SecurityGroup, the API call fails.

Secured by basic

secGroupVMNodes /translation/virtualmachines get

Working With Virtual Machines in a Security Group

get

Retrieve effective membership of a security group in terms of virtual machines. The effective membership is calculated using all the three membership components of a security group - static include, static exclude, and dynamic using the following formula:

Effective membership virtual machines = [ (VMs resulting from static include component + VMs resulting from dynamic component) - (VMs resulting from static exclude component) ]

get secGroupVMNodes /2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}/translation/virtualmachines

Retrieve effective membership of a security group in terms of virtual machines. The effective membership is calculated using all the three membership components of a security group - static include, static exclude, and dynamic using the following formula:

Effective membership virtual machines = [ (VMs resulting from static include component + VMs resulting from dynamic component) - (VMs resulting from static exclude component) ]

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Security group ID.

Secured by basic

secGroupIPNodes /translation/ipaddresses get

Working With IP Addresses in a Security Group

get

Retrieve list of IP addresses that belong to a specific security group.

Retrieve list of IP addresses that belong to a specific security group.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • objectId: required (string)

    Security group ID.

Secured by basic

secGroupLookupVM /lookup/virtualmachine/{virtualMachineId} get

Working With Virtual Machine Security Group Membership

get

Retrieves the collection of security groups to which a virtual machine is a direct or indirect member. Indirect membership involves nesting of security groups.

get secGroupLookupVM /2.0/services/securitygroup/lookup/virtualmachine/{virtualMachineId}

Retrieves the collection of security groups to which a virtual machine is a direct or indirect member. Indirect membership involves nesting of security groups.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • virtualMachineId: required (string)

    Specified virtual machine

Secured by basic

Working With IP Address in a Security Group

get

Retrieve all the security groups that contain the specified IP address.

get secGroupLookupIP /2.0/services/securitygroup/lookup/ipaddress/{ipAddress}

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

  • ipAddress: required (string)

    Specified IP address

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<securityGroups>
  <securityGroups>
    <securitygroup>
      <objectId>securitygroup-654</objectId>
      <objectTypeName>SecurityGroup</objectTypeName>
      <vsmUuid>42013FC7-556D-36E8-EB79-DF359AE8AC70</vsmUuid>
      <nodeId>a51981cd-18e1-4f55-abeb-079d61ca72fb</nodeId>
      <revision>5</revision>
      <type>
        <typeName>SecurityGroup</typeName>
      </type>
      <name>NSBU1-SG-AC-WORKDAY-DEV-XX-STATE-SMB</name>
      <description></description>
      <scope>
        <id>globalroot-0</id>
        <objectTypeName>GlobalRoot</objectTypeName>
        <name>Global</name>
      </scope>
      <clientHandle></clientHandle>
      <extendedAttributes />
      <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
      <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
      <inheritanceAllowed>false</inheritanceAllowed>
      <member>
        <objectId>vm-156</objectId>
        <objectTypeName>VirtualMachine</objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid>42013FC7-556D-36E8-EB79-DF359AE8AC70</vsmUuid>
        <nodeId>a51981cd-18e1-4f55-abeb-079d61ca72fb</nodeId>
        <revision>7</revision>
        <type>
          <typeName>VirtualMachine</typeName>
        </type>
        <name>Web01</name>
        <scope>
          <id>resgroup-v151</id>
          <objectTypeName>VirtualApp</objectTypeName>
          <name>3 Tier App</name>
        </scope>
        <clientHandle></clientHandle>
        <extendedAttributes />
        <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
        <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
      </member>
      <member>
        <objectId>ipset-152</objectId>
        <objectTypeName>IPSet</objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid>42013FC7-556D-36E8-EB79-DF359AE8AC70</vsmUuid>
        <nodeId>a51981cd-18e1-4f55-abeb-079d61ca72fb</nodeId>
        <revision>3</revision>
        <type>
          <typeName>IPSet</typeName>
        </type>
        <name>IPSET-INTERNAL-TRUST-ZGF-003</name>
        <description></description>
        <scope>
          <id>globalroot-0</id>
          <objectTypeName>GlobalRoot</objectTypeName>
          <name>Global</name>
        </scope>
        <clientHandle></clientHandle>
        <extendedAttributes />
        <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
        <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
      </member>
    </securitygroup>
  </securityGroups>
</securityGroups>

Secured by basic

ipsetCreate /{scopeMoref} post

Creating New IP Sets

post

Create a new IP set.

post ipsetCreate /2.0/services/ipset/{scopeMoref}

Create a new IP set.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • scopeMoref: required (string)

    For scopeMoref use globalroot-0 for non-universal IP sets and use universalroot-0 for universal IP sets.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ipset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</ipset>

Secured by basic

  • Response
  • Security

    The IP set to be queried or changed.

HTTP status code 200

Type: application/xml

Example:

  <objectId>ipset-3</objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName>IPSet</typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name>IPSET-2</name>
  <revision>1</revision>
  <objectTypeName>IPSet</objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</ipset>

Secured by basic

  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ipsetId: required (string)

    The IP set to be queried or changed.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<ipset>
    <objectId>ipset-3</objectId>
    <type>
      <typeName>IPSet</typeName>
    </type>
    <description></description>
    <name>IPSET-2</name>
    <revision>1</revision>
    <objectTypeName>IPSet</objectTypeName>
    <value></value>
</ipset>

Secured by basic

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ipsetId: required (string)

    The IP set to be queried or changed.

Query Parameters

  • force: (boolean)

    Set to true when forcing the removal of an IP set.

vCenterConfig

Configuring NSX Manager with vCenter Server

You can synchronize NSX Manager with a vCenter Server, which enables the Networking and Security tab in the vCenter Web Client to display your VMware Infrastructure inventory.

vCenter Config Parameters

ParameterComments
ipAddressFQDN or IP address of vCenter server.
userNameRequired.
passwordRequired.
certificateThumbprintRequired. Must be colon (:) delimited hexadecimal.
assignRoleToUserOptional. true or false.
pluginDownloadServerOptional.
pluginDownloadPortOptional.

vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig get put

get

Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager.

put

Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server.

get vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig

Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<vcInfo>
  <ipAddress>vcsa-01a.corp.local</ipAddress>
  <userName>administrator@vsphere.local</userName>
  <certificateThumbprint>D2:75:61:24:52:CA:B2:8D:D3:25:3F:78:11:2A:8F:94:5A:30:57:0D</certificateThumbprint>
  <assignRoleToUser>true</assignRoleToUser>
  <vcInventoryLastUpdateTime>1492567224920</vcInventoryLastUpdateTime>
</vcInfo>

Secured by basic

put vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig

Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vcInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="assignRoleToUser"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pluginDownloadServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pluginDownloadPort"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<vcInfo>
  <ipAddress>vc-l-01a.corp.local</ipAddress>
  <userName>administrator@vsphere.local</userName>
  <password>VMware123</password>
  <certificateThumbprint>D2:75:61:24:52:CA:B2:8D:D3:25:3F:78:11:2A:8F:94:5A:30:57:0D</certificateThumbprint>
  <assignRoleToUser>true</assignRoleToUser>
  <pluginDownloadServer></pluginDownloadServer>
  <pluginDownloadPort></pluginDownloadPort>
</vcInfo>

Secured by basic

vCenterStatus /status get

get

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<vcConfigStatus>
  <connected>true</connected>
  <lastInventorySyncTime>1492568145678</lastInventorySyncTime>
</vcConfigStatus>

Secured by basic

vCenterConnectionStatus /connectionstatus post

Working with vCenter Server Connection

Validates the vCenter connection by actually trying connection to vCenter Server with the available credentials instead of the cached state. Returns true if vCenter connectivity is successful and false if fails. If the vCenter connectivity has issues, then it disconnects the default connection.

Note: If previously connected, this API tries to re-connect to the vCenter Server which may take time to respond. If vCenter Server is non-responsive, then the API may result in timeout error.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.
post

Update the vCenter Server connection status.

post vCenterConnectionStatus /2.0/services/vcconfig/connectionstatus

Update the vCenter Server connection status.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • action: (string)

    Use action=update to update the vCenter connection. If the action is not specified then the default value is update.

Secured by basic

IndexMaintenanceConfig

Configuring Index Maintainance

If you have few tables in the database that is taking up most of the space, you can configure your index maintenance activities. You can reindex the tables, and tables with index bloat size greater than 75% are reindexed.

IndexMaintenanceConfig /2.0/services/housekeeping/management/index_maintenance get put post

get

Retrieve the default settings for the index maintenance activities.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.3Method introduced.
put

Update the index maintenance default settings. You can enable or disable the settings and change the CRON configuration. To make the changes effective, you must restart the NSX Manager. To change the CRON expression, make sure the new CRON expression is correct using any CRON evaluators. Note that incorrect CRON expression will not run the reindexing task at the expected frequency.

CRON expression guidelines:

CRON expression pattern is a list of six single space-separated fields,representing second, minute, hour, day, month, weekday. Month and weekday can be given as first three letters of the English names. You can refer to the following Web sites for details:

  • https://docs.spring.io/spring/docs/current/javadoc-api/org/springframework/scheduling/support/CronSequenceGenerator.html
  • http://www.manpagez.com/man/5/crontab/

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.3Method introduced.
post

Trigger the reindexing task on demand. Tables with index bloat size greater than 75% are reindexed.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.3Method introduced.

get IndexMaintenanceConfig /2.0/services/housekeeping/management/index_maintenance

Retrieve the default settings for the index maintenance activities.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.3Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<housekeepingModule>
  <moduleName>index_maintenance</moduleName>
  <housekeepingEnabled>true</housekeepingEnabled>
  <scheduleType>cron</scheduleType>
  <scheduleTimeMillis>0</scheduleTimeMillis>
  <cronExpression>0 0 0 1-7 * SAT</cronExpression>
</housekeepingModule>

Secured by basic

put IndexMaintenanceConfig /2.0/services/housekeeping/management/index_maintenance

Update the index maintenance default settings. You can enable or disable the settings and change the CRON configuration. To make the changes effective, you must restart the NSX Manager. To change the CRON expression, make sure the new CRON expression is correct using any CRON evaluators. Note that incorrect CRON expression will not run the reindexing task at the expected frequency.

CRON expression guidelines:

CRON expression pattern is a list of six single space-separated fields,representing second, minute, hour, day, month, weekday. Month and weekday can be given as first three letters of the English names. You can refer to the following Web sites for details:

  • https://docs.spring.io/spring/docs/current/javadoc-api/org/springframework/scheduling/support/CronSequenceGenerator.html
  • http://www.manpagez.com/man/5/crontab/

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.3Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<housekeepingModule>
  <moduleName>index_maintenance</moduleName>
  <housekeepingEnabled>true</housekeepingEnabled>
  <scheduleType>cron</scheduleType>
  <scheduleTimeMillis>0</scheduleTimeMillis>
  <cronExpression>0 0 0 1-5 * SAT</cronExpression>
</housekeepingModule>

Secured by basic

post IndexMaintenanceConfig /2.0/services/housekeeping/management/index_maintenance

Trigger the reindexing task on demand. Tables with index bloat size greater than 75% are reindexed.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.3.3Method introduced.
Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • action: required (string)

    Use action=invokenow to trigger the reindexing task.

Secured by basic

CPUConfiguration

Configuring the High CPU Usage Reporting Tool

You can configure the monitoring of high CPU usage for a defined time period using the High CPU Usage Reporting tool. The CPU Usage Monitoring Tool uses this configuration to monitor CPU utilization of the NSX Manager. You can configure the parameter values to monitor the CPU utilization.

CPU Configuration Parameters

ParameterComments
delayTime between two monitoring sessions in milliseconds.
intervalsThe number of monitoring sessions. This is a positive integer value.
highcputhresholdEnter threshold value for high CPU usage. Threshold value is a percentage value ranging from 1 to 100.
mediumcputhresholdEnter threshold value for medium CPU usage. Threshold value is a percentage value ranging from 1 to 100.
monitoringfeatureenabledEnter true to enable CPU usage monitoring feature. Enter false to disable CPU usage monitoring feature.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.

CPUConfiguration /2.0/services/configuration get put

get

Get the configuration details for the High CPU Usage Reporting Tool.

put

Update the configuration for the High CPU Usage Reporting Tool.

get CPUConfiguration /2.0/services/configuration

Get the configuration details for the High CPU Usage Reporting Tool.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<configurations>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>delay</name>
    <value>10000</value>
  </configuration>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>intervals</name>
    <value>3</value>
  </configuration>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>highcputhreshold</name>
    <value>10</value>
  </configuration>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>mediumcputhreshold</name>
    <value>5</value>
  </configuration>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>monitoringfeatureenabled</name>
    <value>true</value>
  </configuration>
</configurations>

Secured by basic

put CPUConfiguration /2.0/services/configuration

Update the configuration for the High CPU Usage Reporting Tool.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<configurations>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>delay</name>
    <value>10000</value>
  </configuration>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>intervals</name>
    <value>3</value>
  </configuration>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>highcputhreshold</name>
    <value>10</value>
  </configuration>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>mediumcputhreshold</name>
    <value>5</value>
  </configuration>
  <configuration>
    <context>HighCPUReportingTool</context>
    <name>monitoringfeatureenabled</name>
    <value>true</value>
  </configuration>
</configurations>

Secured by basic

CPUUsage

Working with the CPU Usage Monitoring Tool

Monitoring tool monitors CPU usage of the NSX Manager. The configurations for the CPU usage are defined in the High CPU Usage Reporting Tool. Monitoring tool displays values for CPU utilization as High, Medium, and Low.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.

CPUUsageIndicatorStatus /indicator get

Working With CPU Usage Indicator

get

Retrieve the CPU utilization status and the CPU usage percentage.

get CPUUsageIndicatorStatus /2.0/system-monitor/cpuusage/indicator

Retrieve the CPU utilization status and the CPU usage percentage.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<cpuUsageSummary>
  <cpuUsageIndicator>HIGH</cpuUsageIndicator>
  <cpuUsagePercent>89</cpuUsagePercent>
</cpuUsageSummary>

Secured by basic

CPUUsageDetailsStatus /details get

Working With CPU Usage Details

get

Retrieve the details of the module which is causing high CPU utilization for the NSX Manager.

get CPUUsageDetailsStatus /2.0/system-monitor/cpuusage/details

Retrieve the details of the module which is causing high CPU utilization for the NSX Manager.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<cpuUsageDetails>
  <highCPUPeriodInSeconds>30</highCPUPeriodInSeconds>
  <cpuConsumedTasks>
    <taskCPUDetails>
      <moduleName>DynamicCriteriaEvaluation</moduleName>
      <taskType>com.vmware.vshield.vsm.task.utils.SimpleTaskManager$1</taskType>
      <totalTasks>66</totalTasks>
      <displayName>DynamicCriteriaEvaluation</displayName>
      <totalCPU>17274</totalCPU>
    </taskCPUDetails>
  </cpuConsumedTasks>
  <queuedTasks/>
</cpuUsageDetails>

Secured by basic

universalSync

Working With Universal Sync Configuration in Cross-vCenter NSX

universalSyncConfigurationRole /configuration/role post get

Working With Universal Sync Configuration Roles

You can set the role of an NSX Manager to primary, secondary, or standalone. If you set an NSX Manager’s role to primary, then use it to create universal objects, and then set the role to standalone, the role will be set as transit. In the transit role, the universal objects will still exist, but cannot be modified, other than being deleted.

post

Set the universal sync configuration role.

get

Retrieve the universal sync configuration role.

post universalSyncConfigurationRole /2.0/universalsync/configuration/role

Set the universal sync configuration role.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • action: required (string)

    Set the role of the NSX manager. Possible values are set-as-standalone, or set-as-primary. To set an NSX Manager as secondary, use the POST /api/2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers method on the primary NSX Manager.

Secured by basic

get universalSyncConfigurationRole /2.0/universalsync/configuration/role

Retrieve the universal sync configuration role.

Secured by basic
  • Security

Secured by basic

universalSyncConfigurationNsxManagers /configuration/nsxmanagers post get delete

Working With Universal Sync Configuration of NSX Managers

post

Add a secondary NSX manager.

Run this method on the primary NSX Manager, providing details of the secondary NSX Manager.

Retrieve the certificate thumbprint of the secondary NSX Manager using the GET /api/1.0/appliance-management/certificatemanager/certificates/nsx method. The sha1Hash parameter contains the thumbprint.

get

If run on a primary NSX Manager, it will list secondary NSX Managers configured on the primary NSX Manager.

If run on a secondary NSX Manager, it will list information about the secondary NSX Manager and the primary NSX Manager it is associated with.

delete

Delete secondary NSX manager configuration.

post universalSyncConfigurationNsxManagers /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers

Add a secondary NSX manager.

Run this method on the primary NSX Manager, providing details of the secondary NSX Manager.

Retrieve the certificate thumbprint of the secondary NSX Manager using the GET /api/1.0/appliance-management/certificatemanager/certificates/nsx method. The sha1Hash parameter contains the thumbprint.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nsxManagerInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerIp"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerUsername"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerPassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isPrimary"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Example:

<nsxManagerInfo>
  <nsxManagerIp></nsxManagerIp>
  <nsxManagerUsername></nsxManagerUsername>
  <nsxManagerPassword></nsxManagerPassword>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
  <isPrimary></isPrimary>
</nsxManagerInfo>

Secured by basic

get universalSyncConfigurationNsxManagers /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers

If run on a primary NSX Manager, it will list secondary NSX Managers configured on the primary NSX Manager.

If run on a secondary NSX Manager, it will list information about the secondary NSX Manager and the primary NSX Manager it is associated with.

Secured by basic
  • Security

Secured by basic

delete universalSyncConfigurationNsxManagers /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers

Delete secondary NSX manager configuration.

Secured by basic
  • Security

Secured by basic

universalSyncConfigurationManagers /{nsxManagerID} get delete put

Universal Sync Configuration of a Specific NSX Manager

get

Retrieve information about the specified secondary NSX Manager.

delete

Delete the specified secondary NSX Manager.

put

Update the the specified secondary NSX manager IP or thumbprint in the universal sync configuration.

get universalSyncConfigurationManagers /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/{nsxManagerID}

Retrieve information about the specified secondary NSX Manager.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • nsxManagerID: required (string)

    NSX Manager UUID.

Secured by basic

delete universalSyncConfigurationManagers /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/{nsxManagerID}

Delete the specified secondary NSX Manager.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • nsxManagerID: required (string)

    NSX Manager UUID.

Query Parameters

  • universalSyncConfigurationManagerDeleteforceRemoval: (boolean)

    Force removal of a secondary NSX Manager. Options are true and false.

Secured by basic

put universalSyncConfigurationManagers /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/{nsxManagerID}

Update the the specified secondary NSX manager IP or thumbprint in the universal sync configuration.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • nsxManagerID: required (string)

    NSX Manager UUID.

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

universalSyncConfigurationManagersUpdate.xsd

Example:

<nsxManagerInfo>
  <uuid></uuid>
  <nsxManagerIp></nsxManagerIp>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
</nsxManagerInfo>

Secured by basic

universalSyncSync /sync post

NSX Manager Synchronization

post

Sync all objects on the NSX Manager.

post universalSyncSync /2.0/universalsync/sync

Sync all objects on the NSX Manager.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • application: required (string)

    Use invoke to sync all objects on the NSX Manager.

Secured by basic

universalSyncEntityStatus /entitystatus get

get

Retrieve the status of a universal sync entity.

get universalSyncEntityStatus /2.0/universalsync/entitystatus

Retrieve the status of a universal sync entity.

Secured by basic
  • Request
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • objectType: required (string)

    Specify the object type. For example VdnScope.

  • objectId: required (string)

    Specify the objectID. For example globalvdnscope.

Secured by basic

universalSyncStatus /status get

Working With Universal Sync Status

get

Retrieve the universal sync status.

get universalSyncStatus /2.0/universalsync/status

Retrieve the universal sync status.

Secured by basic
  • Security

Secured by basic

applianceManager

Working With the Appliance Manager

With the appliance management tool, you can manage:

  • System configurations like network configuration, syslog, time settings, and certificate management etc.
  • Components of appliance such as NSX Manager, Postgres, SSH component, RabbitMQ service.
  • Overall support related features such as tech support logs, backup restore, status, and summary reports of appliance health.

globalInfo /global/info get

Global Information for NSX Manager

get

Retrieve global information containing version information as well as current logged in user.

get globalInfo /1.0/appliance-management/global/info

Retrieve global information containing version information as well as current logged in user.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<globalInfo>
  <currentLoggedInUser>admin</currentLoggedInUser>
  <versionInfo>
    <majorVersion>6</majorVersion>
    <minorVersion>2</minorVersion>
    <patchVersion>5</patchVersion>
    <buildNumber>4818372</buildNumber>
  </versionInfo>
</globalInfo>

Secured by basic

systemInfo /summary/system get

Summary Information for NSX Manager

get

Retrieve system summary info such as address, DNS name, version, CPU, memory and storage.

get systemInfo /1.0/appliance-management/summary/system

Retrieve system summary info such as address, DNS name, version, CPU, memory and storage.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<systemSummary>
  <ipv4Address>192.168.110.15</ipv4Address>
  <dnsName>nsxmgr-01a</dnsName>
  <hostName>nsxmgr-01a</hostName>
  <applianceName>vShield Virtual Appliance Management</applianceName>
  <versionInfo>
    <majorVersion>6</majorVersion>
    <minorVersion>2</minorVersion>
    <patchVersion>5</patchVersion>
    <buildNumber>4818372</buildNumber>
  </versionInfo>
  <uptime>25 days, 21 hours, 51 minutes</uptime>
  <cpuInfoDto>
    <totalNoOfCPUs>4</totalNoOfCPUs>
    <capacity>2799 MHZ</capacity>
    <usedCapacity>49 MHZ</usedCapacity>
    <freeCapacity>2750 MHZ</freeCapacity>
    <usedPercentage>2</usedPercentage>
  </cpuInfoDto>
  <memInfoDto>
    <totalMemory>16025 MB</totalMemory>
    <usedMemory>5633 MB</usedMemory>
    <freeMemory>10392 MB</freeMemory>
    <usedPercentage>35</usedPercentage>
  </memInfoDto>
  <storageInfoDto>
    <totalStorage>86G</totalStorage>
    <usedStorage>22G</usedStorage>
    <freeStorage>64G</freeStorage>
    <usedPercentage>25</usedPercentage>
  </storageInfoDto>
  <currentSystemDate>Wednesday, 19 April 2017 06:02:32 AM UTC</currentSystemDate>
</systemSummary>

Secured by basic

componentInfo /summary/components get

Component Information for NSX Manager

get

Retrieve summary of all available components and their status info.

get componentInfo /1.0/appliance-management/summary/components

Retrieve summary of all available components and their status info.

Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<componentsSummary>
  <componentsByGroup class="tree-map">
    <entry>
      <string>COMMON</string>
      <components>
        <component>
          <componentId>VPOSTGRES</componentId>
          <name>vPostgres</name>
          <description>vPostgres - Database service</description>
          <status>RUNNING</status>
          <enabled>true</enabled>
          <showTechSupportLogs>false</showTechSupportLogs>
          <usedBy>
            <string>NSX</string>
          </usedBy>
          <componentGroup>COMMON</componentGroup>
        </component>
        <component>
          <componentId>RABBITMQ</componentId>
          <name>RabbitMQ</name>
          <description>RabbitMQ - Messaging service</description>
          <status>RUNNING</status>
          <enabled>true</enabled>
          <showTechSupportLogs>false</showTechSupportLogs>
          <usedBy>
            <string>NSX</string>
          </usedBy>
          <componentGroup>COMMON</componentGroup>
        </component>
      </components>
    </entry>
    <entry>
      <string>NSXGRP</string>
      <components>
        <component>
          <componentId>NSXREPLICATOR</componentId>
          <name>NSX Replicator</name>
          <description>NSX Replicator</description>
          <status>RUNNING</status>
          <enabled>true</enabled>
          <showTechSupportLogs>false</showTechSupportLogs>
          <uses>
            <string>NSX</string>
          </uses>
          <usedBy/>
          <componentGroup>NSXGRP</componentGroup>
          <versionInfo>
            <majorVersion>6</majorVersion>
            <minorVersion>2</minorVersion>
            <patchVersion>5</patchVersion>
            <buildNumber>4818383</buildNumber>
          </versionInfo>
        </component>
        <component>
          <componentId>NSX</componentId>
          <name>NSX Manager</name>
          <description>NSX Manager</description>
          <status>RUNNING</status>
          <enabled>true</enabled>
          <showTechSupportLogs>true</showTechSupportLogs>
          <uses>
            <string>VPOSTGRES</string>
            <string>RABBITMQ</string>
          </uses>
          <usedBy>
            <string>NSXREPLICATOR</string>
          </usedBy>
          <componentGroup>NSXGRP</componentGroup>
          <versionInfo>
            <majorVersion>6</majorVersion>
            <minorVersion>2</minorVersion>
            <patchVersion>5</patchVersion>
            <buildNumber>4818372</buildNumber>
          </versionInfo>
        </component>
      </components>
    </entry>
    <entry>
      <string>SYSTEM</string>
      <components>
        <component>
          <componentId>SSH</componentId>
          <name>SSH Service</name>
          <description>Secure Shell</description>
          <status>RUNNING</status>
          <enabled>true</enabled>
          <showTechSupportLogs>false</showTechSupportLogs>
          <usedBy/>
          <componentGroup>SYSTEM</componentGroup>
        </component>
      </components>
    </entry>
  </componentsByGroup>
</componentsSummary>

Secured by basic

systemCPUInfo /system/cpuinfo get

get

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method updated. Added cpuUsageIndicator parameter.

Retrieve NSX Manager Appliance CPU information.

Method history:

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method updated. Added cpuUsageIndicator parameter.
Secured by basic
  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

<cpuInfo>
  <totalNoOfCPUs>4</totalNoOfCPUs>
  <capacity>2799 MHZ</capacity>
  <usedCapacity>47 MHZ</usedCapacity>
  <freeCapacity>2752 MHZ</freeCapacity>
  <usedPercentage>2</usedPercentage>
  <cpuUsageIndicator>LOW</cpuUsageIndicator>
</cpuInfo>

ReleaseModification
6.4.0Method introduced.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/xml

Example:

  <highCPUPeriodInSeconds>30</highCPUPeriodInSeconds>
  <cpuConsumedTasks>
    <taskCPUDetails>
      <moduleName>DynamicCriteriaEvaluation</moduleName>
      <taskType>com.vmware.vshield.vsm.task.utils.SimpleTaskManager$1</taskType>
      <totalTasks>66</totalTasks>
      <displayName>DynamicCriteriaEvaluation</displayName>
      <totalCPU>17274</totalCPU>
    </taskCPUDetails>
  </cpuConsumedTasks>
  <queuedTasks/>
</cpuUsageDetails>
